description:
Did you know that we spend between 33% - 55% of our time in meetings? Yet many people regard them as too long, frustrating and wasteful.

Knowing exactly what to do as a facilitator and participant in meetings will dramatically reduce the length and need for them, which means that you can take back as much as 1 extra day per week to focus on your top work priorities.

This course is designed to teach you the entire process of meetings, from the planning phase, right through to the last phase - reflecting on results, and also empowers you to conduct one-on-one meetings, conferences, events and workshops. This means that you get an entire package that will help you quickly get to the 2 most important goals of meetings - DECISIONS & ACTIONS.

This course also includes 47 lectures that are straight to the point. There are several exercises and downloadable documents for you. We start off by letting you evaluate how you experience meetings and then provide you will a whole toolbox of solutions to potential problems you may face during meetings, so at the end of this course you will:

1. Be an excellent facilitator that knows how to deal with members, get them involved, use strategies to resolve conflict, reach consensus and properly close & summarize a meeting.

2. Use a powerful structure that will lead to decisions and actions.

3. Create unique experiences by asking powerful questions to keep members focused on the goals and objectives of a meeting.

4. Eliminate the meeting epidemic, save time and gain respect from your colleagues.

5. Turn useless meetings into superb experiences.

6. Take advantage of minute taking techniques.

7. Enjoy the BONUS section on one-on-one meetings, conferences & events and workshops.

8. What to do and not to do during virtual meetings.

... and many more.

If you feel that 50% of your time is wasted in useless meetings, or that you really would like to expand your facilitation skills or want to give more valuable contributions, then this course is for you!
title: Great Meetings Make Decisions, Actions and Results Easy
